http://mediamatters.org/research/2008/10/09/hannity-vs-hannity-is-he-or-is-he-not-a-journal/145571

*Sean Hannity defended the presence of Andy Martin on the October 5 edition 
of Hannity's America by saying, "I'm a journalist who interviews people who 
I disagree with all the time, that give their opinion. Fox has all points 
of view." But Hannity told the New York Daily News that he "doesn't call 
himself a journalist, but rather a talk show host." And in 2004, Hannity 
said: "I'm not a journalist. I am an outspoken, compassionate, thoughtful, 
independent-thinking conservative. ... Unlike these other guys that claim 
to be fair."*

It seems Sean Hannity cannot make up his mind on this...

Fox News Like MSNBC portray their "commentators" as Journalists. It's that

comments.text:
+Elder warrior  Yes, TYT does have a progressive viewpoint. But at the same 
time they don't lie and try to spread fear like Fox. They may make 
honest mistakes in their reporting sometimes but I think they report more 
honestly than a lot of other news sources. They've criticized Obama 
countless times but they don't say nutty things like he's socialist or not 
a citizen. And if somebody says something that's untrue they call them out 
on it instead of fanning the flames ridiculous speculation. If you're a 
conservative you probably won't like much of what you hear but at least 
it's not a propaganda machine for the Democratic party propped up by a 
billionaire with an agenda.
